title: why does a kayle with 3 attack speed items kill me in 1.5 seconds????
body: An adc probably won't do that damage and they definitely won't be immune to damage

replies.body: huh. why does kayle use hurricane?

Her passive Holy Fervor and her Righteous Fury work well with those items if I'm not mistaken. After taking a look at her [Wikia page](http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Kayle) it seems my assumption is correct.

---
Holy Fervor - Kayle's basic attacks and Reckoning reduce the armor and magic resistance of affected enemy champions by 3% for 5 seconds, stacking up to 5 times for a maximum of 15%.
---
Righteous Fury - Passive: Kayle's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage.

* Bonus Magic Damage: 10 / 15 / 20 / 25 / 30 (+ 15% AP)

Active: Kayle ignites her sword for 10 seconds, gaining bonus attack range, doubling Righteous Fury's on-hit damage, and causing her basic against non-turret enemies to splash to nearby enemies for the duration.
	
* Splash Magic Damage: 20 / 30 / 40 / 50 / 60 (+ 30% AP) (+ 20 / 25 / 30 / 35 / 40% AD)
	
* Enhanced Bonus Magic Damage: 20 / 30 / 40 / 50 / 60 (+ 30% AP)

While Righteous Fury is active, Kayle becomes a ranged champion.

yes, I know what those skills do. But righteous fury doesn't interact with crit, and she already has aoe. After nashor's and rageblade, why not exploit that rageblade passive with more on-hits with a wit's or botrk? or even just straight AP, since once rageblade is stacked you alternate between .45 and .9 AP autos.
Hurricane isn't being built for crit. Its being built to help apply the on-hit affect of her passive to 2 other targets as well most likely.
Splash damage also combos well with Runaan's.
Are the extra bolts also dealing the AoE damage of her Rightous Fury? If so that some serious amounts of AoE!
I believe they do.  Same thing works with Jinx's rocket autos.
